Articles.Content: Yes I know, I probably spent Sateillite wrong in this post but we shall move on. I just wonder how you guys do it? How do you get a space station to fit together, what's its purpose, how do you dock ships and get them on the same orbit and all that? Seriously getting frustrated. is it even possible without mods?

a space station/sat, it depends on what you want to do

docking has to be done with mods

rendezvous, not so much.

Here is a list of helpful threads for Orbital operations:

http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/showthread.php/23729-Making-Artificial-Satellites

http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/showthread.php/23381-ORDA-docking

http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/showthread.php/23102-How-do-you-rendezvous-with-another-craft-in-orbit

besides there are this awesome youtube videos wich explain everything very well:

have Fun !!

edit: and there's always google....

Thanks, I was thinking about using YouTube

If you need any modules done I can help.

Currently under construction is this thing, the Spirion Station. It's completely stock craft, no mods/plugins to help with docking, and weighs 57.71 tons (to date, more pieces coming.)

I just got done adding a module to my station in orbit around Kerbin. While Docking can be done without mods it is far more helpful to have them. (I use Docking Port Alignment Indicator by NavyFish)

Javascript is disabled. View full album

This REALLY isn't relevant to dig up and revive, KSP has changed a lot in the past year.

Locked.
